section.name: PersistenceDelegate
section.p: PersistenceDelegate interface provides useful methods to save and load the tool window manager's workspace. When you request to save the workspace, all settings of ToolWindows with relative descriptors are saved. To obtain an instance of PersistenceDelegate you have to invoke the method getPersistenceDelegate of ToolWindowManager interface. So you can obtain a persistence delegate specific to a particular tool window manager.

MyDoggy arrives with a default implementation provided by org.noos.xing.mydoggy.plaf.persistence.xml.XmlPersistenceDelegate . This implementation use the xml format to store all necessary data. You can found the relative DTD here
Here is an example of a saved workspace.
section.source: <?xml version="1.0" standalone="yes"?> <mydoggy version="1.2.0" pushAwayMode="VERTICAL"> <tools> <tool id="Debug Tool" available="true" visible="true" active="true" autoHide="false" anchor="LEFT" type="DOCKED"> <descriptors> <docked dockLength="1" popupMenuEnabled="false"/> <sliding transparentMode="true" transparentDelay="0" transparentRatio="0.8" enabled="false"/> <floating modal="false" transparentMode="true" transparentDelay="1000" transparentRatio="0.2" enabled="true" x="150" y="200" width="320" height="200"/> </descriptors> </tool> </tools> </mydoggy>
